Definition: In this task you are given a tweet that contains some form of irony. You must classify the type of irony the tweet has. Label the tweets ("polarity","situational","other") based on the irony they have. Situational irony happens when a situation fails to meet some expectations, Label these instances as "situational". polarity irony happens when irony is achieved by inverting the intended sentence, Label these instances as "polarity". There are other kinds of ironies that are neither polarity nor situational, Label these instances as "other". Note that URLs in the text have been replaced with [Link].

Positive Examples.input: crushes are great until you realize they'll never be interested in you.| :p
Positive Examples.explanation: Instance describes a situations that fail to meet expectations.

Positive Examples.input: Oh, thank GOD - our entire office email system is down... the day of a big event. Santa, you know JUST what to get me for xmas.
Positive Examples.explanation: Instance contains an evaluative expression whose polarity (positive, negative) is inverted between the literal and the intended evaluation.

Positive Examples.input: @yWTorres9 time to hit the books then
Positive Examples.explanation: Instance is ironic but doesn't have polarity or situational irony.

Negative Examples.input: Sexist article in the Daily Fail about men wasting money on cycling - accompanied by recommendation for a handbag costing £999.
Negative Examples.explanation: This instance doesn't contain any polarity contrast between the literal and the intended evaluation. Instead its describing a situation that fails to meet the expectations so it should be labeled as "situational"
